messageBody:
Hello,

I have observed that both setup() and the constructor for the test class are
called once for each test method. I have put an example below. Why is the
constructor, and not just setup(), called many times? Shouldn't it be that
only setup is called once for each test? I've used both ant and eclipse to
run the test case. I'm a little fuzzy on how this is even possible.



public class DSLClientTest extends TestCase
{
public DSLClientTest()
{
// This is printed three times
System.out.println("Constructor called");
}

protected void setUp() throws Exception
{
// This is printed three times
System.out.println("setup called");
}

public void testTest1()
{
assertTrue("", true);
}

public void testTest2()
{
assertTrue("", true);
}

public void testTest3()
{
assertTrue("", true);
}
}


Adrian
